properties.name: camel.component.aws-sns.access-key
properties.description: Amazon AWS Access Key

properties.name: camel.component.aws-sns.amazon-s-n-s-client
properties.description: To use the AmazonSNS as the client. The option is a com.amazonaws.services.sns.AmazonSNS type.

properties.name: camel.component.aws-sns.amazon-s-q-s-client
properties.description: An SQS Client to use as bridge between SNS and SQS. The option is a com.amazonaws.services.sqs.AmazonSQS type.

properties.name: camel.component.aws-sns.auto-create-topic
properties.description: Setting the autocreation of the topic

properties.name: camel.component.aws-sns.auto-discover-client
properties.description: Setting the autoDiscoverClient mechanism, if true, the component will look for a client instance in the registry automatically otherwise it will skip that checking.

properties.name: camel.component.aws-sns.autowired-enabled
properties.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

properties.name: camel.component.aws-sns.configuration
properties.description: The component configuration. The option is a org.apache.camel.component.aws.sns.SnsConfiguration type.

properties.name: camel.component.aws-sns.enabled
properties.description: Whether to enable auto configuration of the aws-sns component. This is enabled by default.

properties.name: camel.component.aws-sns.kms-master-key-id
properties.description: The ID of an AWS-managed customer master key (CMK) for Amazon SNS or a custom CMK.

properties.name: camel.component.aws-sns.lazy-start-producer
properties.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

properties.name: camel.component.aws-sns.message-structure
properties.description: The message structure to use such as json

properties.name: camel.component.aws-sns.policy
properties.description: The policy for this queue

properties.name: camel.component.aws-sns.proxy-host
properties.description: To define a proxy host when instantiating the SNS client

properties.name: camel.component.aws-sns.proxy-port
properties.description: To define a proxy port when instantiating the SNS client

properties.name: camel.component.aws-sns.proxy-protocol
properties.description: To define a proxy protocol when instantiating the SNS client

properties.name: camel.component.aws-sns.queue-url
properties.description: The queueUrl to subscribe to

properties.name: camel.component.aws-sns.region
properties.description: The region in which SNS client needs to work. When using this parameter, the configuration will expect the capitalized name of the region (for example AP_EAST_1) You'll need to use the name Regions.EU_WEST_1.name()

properties.name: camel.component.aws-sns.secret-key
properties.description: Amazon AWS Secret Key

properties.name: camel.component.aws-sns.server-side-encryption-enabled
properties.description: Define if Server Side Encryption is enabled or not on the topic

properties.name: camel.component.aws-sns.subject
properties.description: The subject which is used if the message header 'CamelAwsSnsSubject' is not present.

properties.name: camel.component.aws-sns.subscribe-s-n-sto-s-q-s
properties.description: Define if the subscription between SNS Topic and SQS must be done or not
